Simulation analysis calculates ENPV with scale factor α=0.85 and plant size of 200 tons/day, incorporating uncertainty.
ENPV of flexible design (starting with one module) is nearly 44% better than the fixed design ($20.69M vs. $14.27M).
ENPV of fixed design.
The NPV of this fixed design could be as low as minus $25 million, with a maximum of a nearly plus $21 million.
The value of flexibility ranges up to $60 million depending on the learning rates and economies of scale, according to a specific analysis reported on.
Proactive Flexible design generally outperforms the Reactive Adaptive design, especially under riskier scenarios, indicating its potential economic efficiency in adaptation.
Reactive Adaptive design offers substantial gains compared to Fixed design, but Proactive Flexible may further reduce costs under certain scenarios.
Compares lifetime economic performance under different climate scenarios and discount rates. Notes that a discount rate of 5.5% makes the Reactive Adaptive design the dominant solution.

Compares lifetime economic performance under different climate scenarios and discount rates. Mentions that future costs are discounted over the long horizon, reducing the advantage of Proactive Flexible Design.

Mentions ADM can reduce over- and underinvesting, suggesting potential for both cost savings (benefit) and avoidance of insufficient adaptation (benefit). Also acknowledges the risk of lost income for keeping options open. Value 0 reflects that there is no specific value.
